Description: Leaf-shaped arrow-head of pale translucent flint. Carefully retouched bifacially at the edges
Curator's comments: Called a lens-shaped arrowhead by D.Holmes in The Predynastic Lithic Industries of Upper Egypt, v. ii (oxford 1989), 416. This arrowhead and the three others like it found in the same tomb (see EA 57606, 59650) were considered to be amongst the finest examples of Badarian flint work known to the excavator.
Bibliographic references: Brunton & Caton-Thompson 1928 / The Badarian Civilisation and Predynastic Remains near Badari (p. 7, 37; pl. xxix.6)
Acquisition name: Donated by: British School of Archaeology, Egypt
